articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shares in SAS (SAS.ST) tumbled 95% at market open on Wednesday after the Scandinavian airline announced new big shareholders late on Tuesday in a restructuring that will see the group delisted from bourses and existing ownership stakes erased.
articles.title: SAS stock dives 95% as restructuring announced

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An unrelenting selloff in world government bond markets pushed U.S. 30-year Treasury yields to 5% for the first time since 2007 and Germany's 10-year borrowing costs to 3% on Wednesday, moves that could hasten a global economic slowdown.
articles.title: World's biggest bond markets hit by relentless selling

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China said on Wednesday that a demand by the European Union that it partipate in consultations within a "very short" period of time about a probe into electric vehicle subsidies is a severe infringment of China's rights.
articles.title: China rebukes EU, says it is rushing consultations in EV subsidy probe

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Sam Bankman-Fried's trial on charges of stealing billions of dollars from customers of his now-bankrupt FTX cryptocurrency exchange is set to resume on Wednesday, with the judge aiming to finish selecting a jury and move on to opening statements.
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried's trial to resume with jury selection, opening statements

articles.author: Tetsushi Kajimoto, Leika Kihara
articles.description: Japan will take appropriate steps against excessive moves in the yen "without ruling out any options", Finance Minister Shunichi Suzuki said on Wednesday, keeping markets on alert over the chance of yen-buying intervention.
articles.title: Japan will take appropriate steps vs excessive yen moves - finance min

articles.author: Mariko Katsumura, Rocky Swift
articles.description: Mie Kawamata dreamed of owning a home where she could tend a small garden and her 1-year-old daughter could play outside, yet still be close enough to commute to central Tokyo.
articles.title: Surging Tokyo property prices squeeze out young professionals

articles.author: Yoruk Bahceli, Dhara Ranasinghe
articles.description: Resurgent oil prices hurting a deteriorating economy and renewed concerns about Italy's fiscal position mean headwinds for the euro are getting stronger, raising the risk of a move back towards the psychologically key $1 marker.
articles.title: Analysis: Euro parity is back on the dial for FX markets

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: Two families, one enslaved by the other. In many ways, their journeys since emancipation illustrate a broader truth about U.S. history: the legacy of slavery.
articles.title: American Dreams

articles.author: Richard Cowan, David Morgan, Moira Warburton
articles.description: The U.S. House of Representatives was leaderless on Wednesday, after hardline Republicans narrowly won a vote to oust Speaker Kevin McCarthy, an historic move that triggered what will be a lengthy and likely messy battle to find a replacement.
articles.title: US House adrift as Republicans fight over their next leader

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Scientists Moungi Bawendi, Louis Brus and Alexei Ekimov won the 2023 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for "the discovery and synthesis of quantum dots," the award-giving body said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Nobel Chemistry prize awarded for discovery of quantum dots used in LED lights
